page.title: 03Houses & Schools,Chelmsford.
page.content: A prominent feature of the area is the great{diversity of schools,} ranging from one built over 90 years ago to others constructed in the past few years.They include neighbourhood { {primary and comprehensive;}also there are{2 Secondary Selective}and a{R.C. {comprehensive}school,large proportions of the{intakes}of which live{outside {the district. Equally varied is the{housing, old {and new,Council owned and Private, with the newer property on the outskirts of the area gradually eating away{farmland}once producing some of the{finest wheat}in the country.Within these houses mingled with{East Anglian {dialects,}can still be heard the tones of{Rhondda}and{Tyne,}a reminder of folk who came to the town to seek and indeed to find work in the economic depression prior to World War 2.
